intro: Besleria crassicaulis, commonly known as the broad-stemmed besleria, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Besleria crassicaulis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
